model

Interface CommonJDBC<Entity>

  • Type Parameters:
    Entity - The entity class which will utilize these JDBC actions
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseJDBC, CookJDBC, EmployeeJDBC, HostessJDBC, ManagerJDBC, SalesJDBC, ServerJDBC, TableJDBC

    public interface CommonJDBC<Entity>
    A generic interface consisting of basic JDBC database actions that any entity class with a corresponding database table should implement
    Author:
    Phillip Witkin

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Entity create(Entity newEntity)
      Inserts a new entry in the appropriate in the appropriate database table(s) for this object
      Entity deleteByID(int ID)
      Delete an entry from the appropriate database table with a matching primary key
      Entity finByID(int ID)
      Finds an object's entry in the database searching for its ID as primary key
      java.util.ArrayList<Entity> findWhere(java.lang.String SQLWhere)
      Finds a collection of objects in the database matching a SQL Where clause
      Entity update(Entity updatedEntity)
      Updates a given object's database information with new information.

    • Method Detail

      • finByID

        Entity finByID(int ID)
        Finds an object's entry in the database searching for its ID as primary key
        Parameters:
        ID - an Integer representation of the ID to search
        Returns:
        The entity in the database with the corresponding ID. Returns null if no match is found.

      • findWhere

        java.util.ArrayList<Entity> findWhere(java.lang.String SQLWhere)
        Finds a collection of objects in the database matching a SQL Where clause
        Parameters:
        SQLWhere - String representation of the WHERE portion of an SQL command
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of objects matching database entries. Returns null if no matches found.

      • update

        Entity update(Entity updatedEntity)
        Updates a given object's database information with new information. Cannot update an ID.
        Parameters:
        updatedEntity - The updated object data; Can have unchanged fields blank, but must contain an ID to update proper entry.
        Returns:
        The updated object with all of its new data. Returns null if the ID in the updatedEntity parameter has no match.

      • create

        Entity create(Entity newEntity)
        Inserts a new entry in the appropriate in the appropriate database table(s) for this object
        Parameters:
        newEntity - An object representing a new database entry
        Returns:
        The newly created object. Returns null if INSERT was not sucessful.

      • deleteByID

        Entity deleteByID(int ID)
        Delete an entry from the appropriate database table with a matching primary key
        Parameters:
        ID - An integer representing the ID of the object with a matching primary key to be deleted
        Returns:
        An object representation of the deleted database entry. Returns null if no match for ID was found.
